For me the cup was contradictory rather than balanced, its sweet chocolate tones uneasily cohabiting with a sharp acidity: think sweet-and-sour chocolate. Nominating reader Woodard Springstube reports that “Plantation Blend is a long-time favorite of mine, although I like all of Community’s blends.”
desc_4: Those who find contradiction exhilarating.
text: Complex aroma: sweet chocolate, some shimmers of flowers and spicy cedar. For me the cup was contradictory rather than balanced, its sweet chocolate tones uneasily cohabiting with a sharp acidity: think sweet-and-sour chocolate. Nominating reader Woodard Springstube reports that “Plantation Blend is a long-time favorite of mine, although I like all of Community’s blends.”

desc_1: Rich, sweet aroma with distinct caramel tones in the finish. Gently lively in the cup, with caramel, cocoa, and temperate fruit notes – I’d call them apple. A low-key cup, just spirited enough to avoid laziness. Several readers nominated Dunkin’ Donuts coffees.
desc_4: Those for whom a caramel-covered apple on a summer afternoon sounds like a good idea.
text: Rich, sweet aroma with distinct caramel tones in the finish. Gently lively in the cup, with caramel, cocoa, and temperate fruit notes – I’d call them apple. A low-key cup, just spirited enough to avoid laziness. Several readers nominated Dunkin’ Donuts coffees.

desc_1: Low-key, bittersweet and roasty in the aroma with suggestions of apple and charred cedar. In the cup sweet floral top notes float almost irrelevantly over the rather densely monotoned, pungently dark-roast heart. The cup softens and sweetens as it cools, however, allowing the floral notes to bloom in pleasant counterpoint to the pungency.
desc_4: Those lovers of dark roasts who enjoy a compensating arabesque of floral sweetness.
text: Low-key, bittersweet and roasty in the aroma with suggestions of apple and charred cedar. In the cup sweet floral top notes float almost irrelevantly over the rather densely monotoned, pungently dark-roast heart. The cup softens and sweetens as it cools, however, allowing the floral notes to bloom in pleasant counterpoint to the pungency.

desc_1: Deep, resonant aroma, gently pungent, complicated by ripe cherry and fresh leather. In the cup settles into a classic traditionally processed Sumatra cup: musty earth tones and tart fruit notes, tamarind and dry cherry perhaps. Reader Pat Teel nominated another Hunter Bay coffee (Kaffe Moose Drool); we received this one as a bonus.
desc_4: A classic Sumatra cup with reassuring environmental credentials.
text: Deep, resonant aroma, gently pungent, complicated by ripe cherry and fresh leather. In the cup settles into a classic traditionally processed Sumatra cup: musty earth tones and tart fruit notes, tamarind and dry cherry perhaps. Reader Pat Teel nominated another Hunter Bay coffee (Kaffe Moose Drool); we received this one as a bonus.

desc_1: Simple aroma, bittersweet without much complication – a shimmer of fruit perhaps. In the cup turns from simple to gently classic: sweet, nutlike, temperate fruit notes reading as milk chocolate. Nominated by Deborah Ciangura of Wilmington, North Carolina.
desc_4: Those who prefer small pleasures to large excitements.
text: Simple aroma, bittersweet without much complication – a shimmer of fruit perhaps. In the cup turns from simple to gently classic: sweet, nutlike, temperate fruit notes reading as milk chocolate. Nominated by Deborah Ciangura of Wilmington, North Carolina.

desc_1: Superbly complex aroma; elegantly fruity: ripe apricot, cherry, cedar, fresh leather. Slightly imbalanced in the cup by an intense acidity only partly buffered by sweetness, but recovers itself in a long, rich finish. Anonymously nominated.
desc_4: Those who enjoy fruity but aggressively dry table wines.
text: Superbly complex aroma; elegantly fruity: ripe apricot, cherry, cedar, fresh leather. Slightly imbalanced in the cup by an intense acidity only partly buffered by sweetness, but recovers itself in a long, rich finish. Anonymously nominated.

desc_1: A gently austere cup: balanced, lightly acidy, crisply and quietly complex: dried apricot, bittersweet chocolate, perhaps a twist of fresh-cut cedar. Softens and sweetens engagingly as it cools. Reader Maria Rueda from Washington, D.C. finds “It’s the best coffee I’ve every tried!”
desc_4: Those who prefer linen to silk.
text: A gently austere cup: balanced, lightly acidy, crisply and quietly complex: dried apricot, bittersweet chocolate, perhaps a twist of fresh-cut cedar. Softens and sweetens engagingly as it cools. Reader Maria Rueda from Washington, D.C. finds “It’s the best coffee I’ve every tried!”

desc_1: A lush, complex cup that derives some of its considerable appeal from slightly fermented fruit tones: apricot in the aroma, apple and pear in the cup, all turned overripe and slightly chocolate-leaning by the ferment. Some cups were gloriously sweet and juicily fruity; others slightly bitter in the finish. Marcus Fitzsimmons nominated this coffee, adding a general plug for Caribou Coffee: “Awesome selection of various coffees including a welcoming store-side atmosphere.”
desc_4: Those who can't stop eating chocolate-covered raisins.
text: A lush, complex cup that derives some of its considerable appeal from slightly fermented fruit tones: apricot in the aroma, apple and pear in the cup, all turned overripe and slightly chocolate-leaning by the ferment. Some cups were gloriously sweet and juicily fruity; others slightly bitter in the finish. Marcus Fitzsimmons nominated this coffee, adding a general plug for Caribou Coffee: “Awesome selection of various coffees including a welcoming store-side atmosphere.”

desc_1: Sweet, rich, and gently roasty in the aroma. Think caramel and toast. The range of sensation narrows slightly in the cup but remains delicately bracing with crisp dry fruit and cedar notes. Anonymously nominated.
desc_4: Those who enjoy delicately dry table wines.
text: Sweet, rich, and gently roasty in the aroma. Think caramel and toast. The range of sensation narrows slightly in the cup but remains delicately bracing with crisp dry fruit and cedar notes. Anonymously nominated.

desc_1: Crisply rich in the aroma, with sweet apple-toned high notes. In the cup simple and engaging as an early Beatles song, with an acidity felt rather than tasted and seductively fruity milk chocolate notes. W. Morris Brown Jr. nominated this coffee with a simple tribute: “I like it.”
desc_4: Those who skip dessert and compensate with the coffee.
text: Crisply rich in the aroma, with sweet apple-toned high notes. In the cup simple and engaging as an early Beatles song, with an acidity felt rather than tasted and seductively fruity milk chocolate notes. W. Morris Brown Jr. nominated this coffee with a simple tribute: “I like it.”

desc_1: Sweetly melodic, soft but substantial, with a gentle tickle of acidity. A spice-toned chocolate complicates the aroma and resurfaces in a long, easy finish. Nominating reader Monique Tam calls this “The best 100% Kona I have tasted.” It certainly was the best of the four Konas I sampled for this month’s cupping.
desc_4: Those who enjoy softness without sentiment.
text: Sweetly melodic, soft but substantial, with a gentle tickle of acidity. A spice-toned chocolate complicates the aroma and resurfaces in a long, easy finish. Nominating reader Monique Tam calls this “The best 100% Kona I have tasted.” It certainly was the best of the four Konas I sampled for this month’s cupping.

desc_1: Deep and balanced, smooth in mouthfeel, low in acidity, rich with sweet wine- and chocolate-cherry-toned fruit and a resiny hint of cedar. Nominating reader John Outler applies the technical tasting term “Yummy!” to this coffee before continuing “Perfect intersection between dark and light [roast]. Not too bitter.”
desc_4: Those who prefer a plush armchair to a leather one.
text: Deep and balanced, smooth in mouthfeel, low in acidity, rich with sweet wine- and chocolate-cherry-toned fruit and a resiny hint of cedar. Nominating reader John Outler applies the technical tasting term “Yummy!” to this coffee before continuing “Perfect intersection between dark and light [roast]. Not too bitter.”

desc_1: An enormous, enveloping coffee, grandly acidy yet voluptuously sweet. So sweet the term acidy becomes almost moot, though its dry rigor necessarily grounds and complicates the sweetness. Cabernet wine and ripe cherry notes. Anonymously nominated.
desc_4: Those who can handle a flawless marrying of power and elegance.
text: An enormous, enveloping coffee, grandly acidy yet voluptuously sweet. So sweet the term acidy becomes almost moot, though its dry rigor necessarily grounds and complicates the sweetness. Cabernet wine and ripe cherry notes. Anonymously nominated.

desc_1: A classic high-grown Latin-American profile: Cherry- and grape-toned fruit in the sweet, high-toned aroma. In the cup big and smooth-bodied, rich, sweetly but intensely acidy, with an essence-of-coffee fruit that edges toward chocolate.
desc_4: A big, heartily dry old-fashioned coffee with a discreet wiggle of sweetly decadent fruit.
text: A classic high-grown Latin-American profile: Cherry- and grape-toned fruit in the sweet, high-toned aroma. In the cup big and smooth-bodied, rich, sweetly but intensely acidy, with an essence-of-coffee fruit that edges toward chocolate.

desc_1: In the aroma sweetly and cleanly roasty and cedar-toned. The roasty tones turn burned and rather cloyingly sweet in the cup – lightly charred cedar or sandalwood.
desc_4: Those who enjoy dramatically charred foods.
text: In the aroma sweetly and cleanly roasty and cedar-toned. The roasty tones turn burned and rather cloyingly sweet in the cup – lightly charred cedar or sandalwood.

desc_1: Predictable ultra-dark roast: intense and pungent with an edge of charred cedar in the aroma; in the cup thin in mouthfeel and sweetly charred, with a mildly astringent finish that lovers of this style of roast will find bracing.
desc_4: Those who enjoy foods with a charred, vaguely sweet edge.
text: Predictable ultra-dark roast: intense and pungent with an edge of charred cedar in the aroma; in the cup thin in mouthfeel and sweetly charred, with a mildly astringent finish that lovers of this style of roast will find bracing.

desc_1: The cup gives an impression of both thinness and richness. Overripe fruit – peaches perhaps – settle toward an agreeable but pungent chocolate. Two cups of five were bitter, suggesting that the pleasant intrigue of overripe-fruit-cum-chocolate was induced by a slightly fermented component to the blend.
desc_4: Those who enjoy puzzles and contradictions.
text: The cup gives an impression of both thinness and richness. Overripe fruit – peaches perhaps – settle toward an agreeable but pungent chocolate. Two cups of five were bitter, suggesting that the pleasant intrigue of overripe-fruit-cum-chocolate was induced by a slightly fermented component to the blend.

desc_1: Impressive aroma: lush, low-toned apricot fruit. In the cup a full body with a nice heft in the mouthfeel, but the pungent fruit turns increasingly salty and bitter as the cup cools.
desc_4: Those more interested in texture than flavor.
text: Impressive aroma: lush, low-toned apricot fruit. In the cup a full body with a nice heft in the mouthfeel, but the pungent fruit turns increasingly salty and bitter as the cup cools.

desc_1: The chicory in this moderately dark-roasted blend announces itself tactfully but distinctly in the peppery mouthfeel, spicy, resiny notes (think rosemary stored in a scorched cedar box), with a hint of round, slightly, salty fruit underneath – Chinese salt plums perhaps.
desc_4: Those who enjoy (or think they might enjoy) a sort of peppery, fruity backbone to a nicely dark-roasted coffee. Roasted chicory is, as they say, an acquired taste, but so is coffee itself.
text: The chicory in this moderately dark-roasted blend announces itself tactfully but distinctly in the peppery mouthfeel, spicy, resiny notes (think rosemary stored in a scorched cedar box), with a hint of round, slightly, salty fruit underneath – Chinese salt plums perhaps.

desc_1: Roasty and sweetly and gently charred, with a hint of fermented fruit that under the influence of the roast suggests a spicily aromatic chocolate – imagine bittersweet chocolate stored in charred cedar. Rich finish with a tingle of astringency.
desc_4: An interesting and agreeable variant on the theme of ultra-dark roast that nicely pushes the expressive envelope of the style.
text: Roasty and sweetly and gently charred, with a hint of fermented fruit that under the influence of the roast suggests a spicily aromatic chocolate – imagine bittersweet chocolate stored in charred cedar. Rich finish with a tingle of astringency.

desc_1: Impressively complex ultra-dark roast: The roast tones are sweet and rather restrained in the aroma, complicated by fresh leather and apricot. In the cup they turn rich, full-throated and bittersweet. The finish is a touch heavy and astringent, inevitable in a roast this dark.
desc_4: Those lovers of ultra-dark "French" roasts curious to taste a fine version of the style.
text: Impressively complex ultra-dark roast: The roast tones are sweet and rather restrained in the aroma, complicated by fresh leather and apricot. In the cup they turn rich, full-throated and bittersweet. The finish is a touch heavy and astringent, inevitable in a roast this dark.

desc_1: Balanced and roundly high-toned. Slightly roasty, gently acidy. Papaya and fresh leather notes in the aroma; papaya and dark chocolate in the cup. A tickle of astringency in the long finish.
desc_4: Those who prefer the quiet table in the corner.
text: Balanced and roundly high-toned. Slightly roasty, gently acidy. Papaya and fresh leather notes in the aroma; papaya and dark chocolate in the cup. A tickle of astringency in the long finish.

desc_1: Elegant, balanced dark roast: Comfortably sweet with a shimmer of acidity and a hint of roastiness. The bittersweet chocolate and pineapple notes in the aroma deepen and round congenially in the cup.
desc_4: Those who would rather listen than talk.
text: Elegant, balanced dark roast: Comfortably sweet with a shimmer of acidity and a hint of roastiness. The bittersweet chocolate and pineapple notes in the aroma deepen and round congenially in the cup.

desc_1: Rather simple aroma but fine, deep, roasty dimension with distinct dark chocolate notes. In the cup roundly roasty with a tickle of acidity and chocolate and prune-toned fruit. A touch sharp when hot but softens and sweetens as it cools.
desc_4: A fine, balanced, genuinely Vienna-style blend, not striking but quietly forceful.
text: Rather simple aroma but fine, deep, roasty dimension with distinct dark chocolate notes. In the cup roundly roasty with a tickle of acidity and chocolate and prune-toned fruit. A touch sharp when hot but softens and sweetens as it cools.

desc_1: Sweet, balanced, round, with a hint of roastiness and a subtle, shifting bouquet of flowers, fresh leather, spice and apricot that deepen toward chocolate in the cup. As the cup cools it simplifies slightly, turning the fruit a touch shallow and tart.
desc_4: Those who find American medium roast coffees too tartly assertive and American dark-roast coffees too bitterly overbearing.
text: Sweet, balanced, round, with a hint of roastiness and a subtle, shifting bouquet of flowers, fresh leather, spice and apricot that deepen toward chocolate in the cup. As the cup cools it simplifies slightly, turning the fruit a touch shallow and tart.

desc_1: The aroma is roasty and quite sweet, with high-toned cedar and chocolate notes. Round and full in the cup, with a buttery mouthfeel and a balance of gentle roast tones and a tickle of sweet, fruit-toned acidity.
desc_4: Those who maximize pleasure and minimize conflict.
text: The aroma is roasty and quite sweet, with high-toned cedar and chocolate notes. Round and full in the cup, with a buttery mouthfeel and a balance of gentle roast tones and a tickle of sweet, fruit-toned acidity.

desc_1: Delicately rich, with a shimmer of flowers in the aroma, pear deepening toward cherry and chocolate in the cup. Sweet, softly complex finish. The sample I cupped probably was delivered slightly stale from the restaurant; a fresh sample of the same coffee might well merit a higher rating.
desc_4: A Kona to gratify Kona enthusiasts and persuade Kona scoffers.
text: Delicately rich, with a shimmer of flowers in the aroma, pear deepening toward cherry and chocolate in the cup. Sweet, softly complex finish. The sample I cupped probably was delivered slightly stale from the restaurant; a fresh sample of the same coffee might well merit a higher rating.

desc_1: An understated coffee that rewards attention to its gentle virtues. Sweetly balanced roastiness and rich papaya-toned fruit in the aroma; in the cup delicately complex and quietly lush with low-toned, carnal fruit: apricot and papaya.
desc_4: Those who prefer subtle substance over flash.
text: An understated coffee that rewards attention to its gentle virtues. Sweetly balanced roastiness and rich papaya-toned fruit in the aroma; in the cup delicately complex and quietly lush with low-toned, carnal fruit: apricot and papaya.

desc_1: Simultaneously intensely acidy and extravagantly sweet, medium-bodied, with a whole basket of fruit tones: apricot, dry cherry, sweet lemon, a tiny whiff of chocolate, all lush, crisply rich, complex.
desc_4: Austere hedonists.
text: Simultaneously intensely acidy and extravagantly sweet, medium-bodied, with a whole basket of fruit tones: apricot, dry cherry, sweet lemon, a tiny whiff of chocolate, all lush, crisply rich, complex.

desc_1: Voluptuously classic coffee, perfectly poised between an almost sugary sweetness and a crisp, rich acidity. The mouthfeel is big and silky. The basic package is so complete that the hint of cherry- and tamarind-toned fruit comes as a bonus.
desc_4: Those considering moving from coffees that owe their sweetness and body to a darkish roast to coffees that pretty much start that way.
text: Voluptuously classic coffee, perfectly poised between an almost sugary sweetness and a crisp, rich acidity. The mouthfeel is big and silky. The basic package is so complete that the hint of cherry- and tamarind-toned fruit comes as a bonus.

desc_1: A cup that will put off purist coffee professionals but please everyone else: Fermented fruit tones that require some imagination to read as cherryish chocolate in the aroma simply explode with extravagantly complex fruit and floral nuance in the cup. As the cup cools the fruit seems to shed its ambiguous ferment entirely and turn cleanly lush.
desc_4: Lovers of sweet but complex white wines.
text: A cup that will put off purist coffee professionals but please everyone else: Fermented fruit tones that require some imagination to read as cherryish chocolate in the aroma simply explode with extravagantly complex fruit and floral nuance in the cup. As the cup cools the fruit seems to shed its ambiguous ferment entirely and turn cleanly lush.

desc_1: Sweet, richly low-toned, luxuriously fruity, but distinctly musty. The mustiness is the almost effervescent kind that can be charitably read as spice. Cleans up a bit in a long, rather satisfying finish.
desc_4: of musty, aka earthy, Sumatras and Sulawesis.
text: Sweet, richly low-toned, luxuriously fruity, but distinctly musty. The mustiness is the almost effervescent kind that can be charitably read as spice. Cleans up a bit in a long, rather satisfying finish.

desc_1: In the nose distinctly roasty, pungent, but quite sweet and resonantly round-toned. In the cup cleanly burned but still quite sweet, light-bodied but round in impression. Some fruit, perhaps softened by a hint of clean ferment, makes itself felt as the cup cools.
desc_4: An androgynous coffee, roasty but delicately sweet.
text: In the nose distinctly roasty, pungent, but quite sweet and resonantly round-toned. In the cup cleanly burned but still quite sweet, light-bodied but round in impression. Some fruit, perhaps softened by a hint of clean ferment, makes itself felt as the cup cools.

desc_1: Rich in the aroma, pungent fruit, fresh leather, roasty chocolate. The roast tones turn the cup rather sharp and monotoned, however. In the finish softens once again toward a richly dry, chocolate-toned fruit.
desc_4: Those who add milk but no sugar to the cup. Turns crisp and elegant with milk.
text: Rich in the aroma, pungent fruit, fresh leather, roasty chocolate. The roast tones turn the cup rather sharp and monotoned, however. In the finish softens once again toward a richly dry, chocolate-toned fruit.

desc_1: In the nose sweetly pungent, with a round, full, balanced roastiness free of burned tones. The roasty tones sharpen in the cup, however, carrying into a long but rather astringent finish.
desc_4: Those socially and environmentally concerned coffee drinkers who enjoy aromatic but rather bracingly sharp coffees.
text: In the nose sweetly pungent, with a round, full, balanced roastiness free of burned tones. The roasty tones sharpen in the cup, however, carrying into a long but rather astringent finish.

desc_1: The aroma is subtly rich and crisp with dry cocoa tones. In the cup a sweetly balanced, delicately floral, cherry-toned coffee wants to emerge, but something is shadowing the profile, perhaps a very slight but flavor-dampening mildew.
desc_4: Those who want to roll the coffee dice and hope they get a bag of this lovely, delicate coffee free of the very slight shadow taint that haunted this sample.
text: The aroma is subtly rich and crisp with dry cocoa tones. In the cup a sweetly balanced, delicately floral, cherry-toned coffee wants to emerge, but something is shadowing the profile, perhaps a very slight but flavor-dampening mildew.

desc_1: Very sweet and round in both nose and cup, nuanced by a voluptuous fruity chocolate. This low-toned fruit may reveal a slight ferment that most palates will read as a complicating note to the chocolate.
desc_4: Those who enjoy the subtle variations that a soft-profile black coffee works on chocolate.
text: Very sweet and round in both nose and cup, nuanced by a voluptuous fruity chocolate. This low-toned fruit may reveal a slight ferment that most palates will read as a complicating note to the chocolate.

desc_1: Superb aroma: sweet, balanced, intense, with deep dimension and a grand range of nuance, ranging from floral top notes to mid-tones of papaya and perhaps pear. In the cup an explosive entry, with intense, almost contradictory impressions of sweetness, bitterness, acidity and distinct floral and cherry-toned fruit. This amazing cup hardens a bit toward the finish, although the finish itself is smoothly rich and floral.
desc_4: Those who can tolerate some sensory confusion for the sake of grandeur.
text: Superb aroma: sweet, balanced, intense, with deep dimension and a grand range of nuance, ranging from floral top notes to mid-tones of papaya and perhaps pear. In the cup an explosive entry, with intense, almost contradictory impressions of sweetness, bitterness, acidity and distinct floral and cherry-toned fruit. This amazing cup hardens a bit toward the finish, although the finish itself is smoothly rich and floral.

desc_1: In the nose intensely roasty and intensely alive with pungently sweet fruit – passion fruit, or sweet grapefruit. In the cup the powerful coupling of sweet fruit and bitterish roast tones persists. Patient palates may read a raisin-toned dark chocolate in the roasty fruit.
desc_4: This hugely roasty but roundly fruity coffee should please those who prefer their dark roasts powerful but free of burned bitterness.
text: In the nose intensely roasty and intensely alive with pungently sweet fruit – passion fruit, or sweet grapefruit. In the cup the powerful coupling of sweet fruit and bitterish roast tones persists. Patient palates may read a raisin-toned dark chocolate in the roasty fruit.

desc_1: A vastly rich, balanced medium-dark roast, distinctly nuanced from nose to finish with a deep, bittersweet, raisin-toned chocolate. As is often the case with deeply fruit-toned coffees, some of the lush richness may derive from a fortuitous edge of sweet ferment.
desc_4: Those who fingers always drift past the light chocolates to the dark.
text: A vastly rich, balanced medium-dark roast, distinctly nuanced from nose to finish with a deep, bittersweet, raisin-toned chocolate. As is often the case with deeply fruit-toned coffees, some of the lush richness may derive from a fortuitous edge of sweet ferment.

desc_1: Lovely balance of sweet and dryly acidy tones; more than balanced, integrated and smoothly compete in expression. Floral notes in the nose; in the cup the cherry-toned fruit carries pleasing hints of a clean, sweet ferment.
desc_4: Lovers of the soft but crisp style of white wines.
text: Lovely balance of sweet and dryly acidy tones; more than balanced, integrated and smoothly compete in expression. Floral notes in the nose; in the cup the cherry-toned fruit carries pleasing hints of a clean, sweet ferment.

desc_1: Lots of complaints and caveats here. For Willem the aroma was “slightly musty, chocolaty,” for Ken “heavy, bittersweet.” In the demitasse Willem found “bitter, sharp flavor notes” and Ken “sharpish, ponderously sour tones” although he did detect “some incongruous floral topnotes.” “Definitely lacked sweetness with and without milk,” Willem concluded. (80) “Powerful but oddly sourish in milk” for Ken. (81)
desc_4: I suppose that the sour sharpness of this blend, which for better or worse makes a powerful statement in milk, may please those who take their espresso with large quantities of additives.
text: Lots of complaints and caveats here. For Willem the aroma was “slightly musty, chocolaty,” for Ken “heavy, bittersweet.” In the demitasse Willem found “bitter, sharp flavor notes” and Ken “sharpish, ponderously sour tones” although he did detect “some incongruous floral topnotes.” “Definitely lacked sweetness with and without milk,” Willem concluded. (80) “Powerful but oddly sourish in milk” for Ken. (81)

desc_1: Ken found this espresso matched its name: A straightforwardly roasty, simple espresso of the kind pumped out of roadside espresso carts and kiosks all over the Northwest: “Dark-roasted with a smoky bite and a low-toned papaya-like fruit that turns vaguely chocolate in the finish. Smoky and a little flat in milk.” (84) Willem, however, acknowledges only the negative side of the aggressive roast with its limited range: “Burned, dull aroma with unpleasant carbony and cardboard flavor.” (78)
desc_4: Those who like the taste of the roast in their caffe latte.
text: Ken found this espresso matched its name: A straightforwardly roasty, simple espresso of the kind pumped out of roadside espresso carts and kiosks all over the Northwest: “Dark-roasted with a smoky bite and a low-toned papaya-like fruit that turns vaguely chocolate in the finish. Smoky and a little flat in milk.” (84) Willem, however, acknowledges only the negative side of the aggressive roast with its limited range: “Burned, dull aroma with unpleasant carbony and cardboard flavor.” (78)

desc_1: Neither Ken nor Willem developed much enthusiasm for this beautifully packaged coffee. Willem apparently liked the “mild floral notes” in the aroma, but in the cup found both body and flavor “lacked balance and temperature stability,” meaning they changed for the worse as the coffee cooled. (82) Ken found the smoky, low-toned fruity aroma attractive, but the cup bitterly pungent and smoky without resonance or resilience. The coffee failed to “blossom” for him in milk and remained smoky and flat. (82)
desc_4: Admirers of elegant packaging and supporters of the arts with a taste for smoke in their espresso.
text: Neither Ken nor Willem developed much enthusiasm for this beautifully packaged coffee. Willem apparently liked the “mild floral notes” in the aroma, but in the cup found both body and flavor “lacked balance and temperature stability,” meaning they changed for the worse as the coffee cooled. (82) Ken found the smoky, low-toned fruity aroma attractive, but the cup bitterly pungent and smoky without resonance or resilience. The coffee failed to “blossom” for him in milk and remained smoky and flat. (82)

desc_1: This well-known blend, which attracted high ratings in previous Coffee Review tastings, mildly disappointed in this incarnation (Willem 84, Ken 84). Aroma fared well enough. For Willem it was “elegant, complex[ly] floral,” for Ken “sweet, rich, with papaya and perhaps mint.” Both found the small cup imbalanced, however. Willem described it as “acidy [and] spicy,” Ken as “heavily pungent with aromatic wood notes.” This imbalance predictably softened in milk: “Much better with milk than without” Willem concluded, although Ken felt the presence in milk was substantial but “rather ponderous with a woody finish.”
desc_4: Either Starbucks, the new owner of the Torrefazione brand, has already cheapened this blend, or we just happened to buy a partly stale or substandard bag for this tasting. Let's hope it's staling and not Starbucks. This blend's distinguished history and many admirers make it deserving of preservation.
text: This well-known blend, which attracted high ratings in previous Coffee Review tastings, mildly disappointed in this incarnation (Willem 84, Ken 84). Aroma fared well enough. For Willem it was “elegant, complex[ly] floral,” for Ken “sweet, rich, with papaya and perhaps mint.” Both found the small cup imbalanced, however. Willem described it as “acidy [and] spicy,” Ken as “heavily pungent with aromatic wood notes.” This imbalance predictably softened in milk: “Much better with milk than without” Willem concluded, although Ken felt the presence in milk was substantial but “rather ponderous with a woody finish.”

desc_1: Willem found this sample of the Starbucks staple blend “balanced throughout with no major high [positive] or low [negative] notes in aroma, flavor and aftertaste. [In the demitasse] some sweetness with a bitter end note. With milk, sweet, spicy, [with] a mild, pungent aftertaste.” (85) Ken was less impressed. For him the aroma was “smoky, sweet and subdued,” the body lean, the small cup “smoky and simple.” He was most taken with this ubiquitous blend’s impact in milk: “sweetens and rounds, prune fruit softens toward chocolate in the finish.” (83)
desc_4: The same folks to drink it now: those millions who line up for a usually well-prepared espresso drink brewed from a reasonably good espresso blend.
text: Willem found this sample of the Starbucks staple blend “balanced throughout with no major high [positive] or low [negative] notes in aroma, flavor and aftertaste. [In the demitasse] some sweetness with a bitter end note. With milk, sweet, spicy, [with] a mild, pungent aftertaste.” (85) Ken was less impressed. For him the aroma was “smoky, sweet and subdued,” the body lean, the small cup “smoky and simple.” He was most taken with this ubiquitous blend’s impact in milk: “sweetens and rounds, prune fruit softens toward chocolate in the finish.” (83)

desc_1: Ken admired this blend (86) more than Willem (83), who was ambivalent about the aroma (“chocolate with a hint of tobacco”), critical of the small cup (“lacks sweetness and balance”) though mildly approving of performance in milk (“pleasant caramel aftertaste”). For Ken, the aroma also was a bit feeble and musty in its chocolate and papaya suggestions, the cup a bit too dominated by musty and slightly fermented fruit notes, but he felt the finish “smoothed out nicely toward dry prune and chocolate,” and the blend showed excellent presence in milk. He got so carried away he decided he found marzipan and mint notes in the milk finish.
desc_4: Try it in milk and go for the marzipan.
text: Ken admired this blend (86) more than Willem (83), who was ambivalent about the aroma (“chocolate with a hint of tobacco”), critical of the small cup (“lacks sweetness and balance”) though mildly approving of performance in milk (“pleasant caramel aftertaste”). For Ken, the aroma also was a bit feeble and musty in its chocolate and papaya suggestions, the cup a bit too dominated by musty and slightly fermented fruit notes, but he felt the finish “smoothed out nicely toward dry prune and chocolate,” and the blend showed excellent presence in milk. He got so carried away he decided he found marzipan and mint notes in the milk finish.

desc_1: Both Ken and Willem admired the aroma of this rather darkly roasted blend, but the ambiguous flavor notes in the cup provoked ambivalence. For Willem the aroma was “excellent & fine and deep at the same time, with delicious floral notes,” for Ken it was “sweet with a round, roasty chocolate and peach and floral notes.” In the cup Willem found  an “interesting flavor with an overpowering berry, almost musty, fruit aftertaste” (86) and Ken “dominating pungent, smoky tones, with a dry edge of chocolate; rather sharp and thin in the finish.” (83)
desc_4: Those who value intensity over balance.
text: Both Ken and Willem admired the aroma of this rather darkly roasted blend, but the ambiguous flavor notes in the cup provoked ambivalence. For Willem the aroma was “excellent & fine and deep at the same time, with delicious floral notes,” for Ken it was “sweet with a round, roasty chocolate and peach and floral notes.” In the cup Willem found  an “interesting flavor with an overpowering berry, almost musty, fruit aftertaste” (86) and Ken “dominating pungent, smoky tones, with a dry edge of chocolate; rather sharp and thin in the finish.” (83)

desc_1: Ken and Willem were eight points apart on this one. Ken liked the aromatic excitement of the “floral and fruit notes with complex smoky undertones” that he followed with pleasure from aroma through finish to milk. Although he found the small cup a bit sharp and thin-bodied, he forgave all in return for the floral and fruit complexity. (89) Willem, on the other hand, tasted nothing but imbalance and too much acidity: “Somewhat dull aroma with minor earthy notes” and in the small cup “mildly sharp and some uncontrolled acidity.” He was a bit more forgiving with performance in milk: “sweet, bright, with caramel aftertaste.” (81)
desc_4: Those who, like Ken, enjoy a romantically aromatic respite from balance.
text: Ken and Willem were eight points apart on this one. Ken liked the aromatic excitement of the “floral and fruit notes with complex smoky undertones” that he followed with pleasure from aroma through finish to milk. Although he found the small cup a bit sharp and thin-bodied, he forgave all in return for the floral and fruit complexity. (89) Willem, on the other hand, tasted nothing but imbalance and too much acidity: “Somewhat dull aroma with minor earthy notes” and in the small cup “mildly sharp and some uncontrolled acidity.” He was a bit more forgiving with performance in milk: “sweet, bright, with caramel aftertaste.” (81)

desc_1: Both Willem and Ken found this blend satisfying, though not exciting. Willem: “elegant floral aroma. Overall: smooth and soft with pleasantly lingering aftertaste. Rich caramel notes in milk.” (87) Ken: “Complex in a narrow range: smoky, sweet fruit in the aroma, smoky and spicy in the demitasse. Caramelly and sweet though a bit shallow in milk.” (86)
desc_4: A pleasantly versatile espresso for those with a Tully's on the way to work or around the corner.
text: Both Willem and Ken found this blend satisfying, though not exciting. Willem: “elegant floral aroma. Overall: smooth and soft with pleasantly lingering aftertaste. Rich caramel notes in milk.” (87) Ken: “Complex in a narrow range: smoky, sweet fruit in the aroma, smoky and spicy in the demitasse. Caramelly and sweet though a bit shallow in milk.” (86)

desc_1: For Ken this naturally low-acid, lighter roasted blend was “Sweetly musty, cherry and apple in the aroma, heavy body with a tingle in the mouthfeel, crisp and toasty rather than sharp in the small cup, with excellent dimension and range.”(91) Willem was less excited: “Bubbly and rich body. Chocolate, caramel notes with mildly woody then fruit notes in the aftertaste.” (87) For both Ken and Willem, this blend came most distinctly into its own in milk. “Wonderful mastery of milk” according to Ken, “rich, complete, with a sort of carnal, earth-toned fruity chocolate.” Willem: “Fantastic with milk: sweet, rich, lingering chocolate.”
desc_4: Those who value character over elegance; anyone who takes espresso with milk.
text: For Ken this naturally low-acid, lighter roasted blend was “Sweetly musty, cherry and apple in the aroma, heavy body with a tingle in the mouthfeel, crisp and toasty rather than sharp in the small cup, with excellent dimension and range.”(91) Willem was less excited: “Bubbly and rich body. Chocolate, caramel notes with mildly woody then fruit notes in the aftertaste.” (87) For both Ken and Willem, this blend came most distinctly into its own in milk. “Wonderful mastery of milk” according to Ken, “rich, complete, with a sort of carnal, earth-toned fruity chocolate.” Willem: “Fantastic with milk: sweet, rich, lingering chocolate.”

desc_1: Willem: “Blossom-like, peppery aroma, just like the roses from my 50+year-old rose tree! Mild sweet flavor with lingering floral aftertaste. Excellent caramel complexity with milk. I loved it.” (92) What for Willem was peppery and blossom-like, for Ken was spicy and fruity in the aroma and smokily fruity in the small cup. Ken wanted more sweetness in the demitasse but in milk praised this blend as “sweet, crisp and cherry-like edging toward chocolate.” (89).
desc_4: Those who do straight shots and short milk drinks should enjoy this blend's finely understated complexity.
text: Willem: “Blossom-like, peppery aroma, just like the roses from my 50+year-old rose tree! Mild sweet flavor with lingering floral aftertaste. Excellent caramel complexity with milk. I loved it.” (92) What for Willem was peppery and blossom-like, for Ken was spicy and fruity in the aroma and smokily fruity in the small cup. Ken wanted more sweetness in the demitasse but in milk praised this blend as “sweet, crisp and cherry-like edging toward chocolate.” (89).

desc_1: Both Ken and Willem liked this blend, but Willem really liked it: “Floral aroma, buttery, smooth body, sweet flavor with berry and prune notes. Lingering aftertaste with resonant sweetness. Fantastic and complete as milk drink, with chocolate and caramel notes.” (93) Ken honored and enjoyed the fruit notes, which he found complex but rather tart once past the aroma (“tart berry and pineapple, dry chocolate” in the small cup, “tart fruit with a floral finish” in milk). In the end Ken found the cup just a bit short on sweetness and depth of sensation, both with milk and without  (87).
desc_4: Those who enjoy settling a split decision.
text: Both Ken and Willem liked this blend, but Willem really liked it: “Floral aroma, buttery, smooth body, sweet flavor with berry and prune notes. Lingering aftertaste with resonant sweetness. Fantastic and complete as milk drink, with chocolate and caramel notes.” (93) Ken honored and enjoyed the fruit notes, which he found complex but rather tart once past the aroma (“tart berry and pineapple, dry chocolate” in the small cup, “tart fruit with a floral finish” in milk). In the end Ken found the cup just a bit short on sweetness and depth of sensation, both with milk and without  (87).

desc_1: The aroma is flat and thin. In the cup sweetly but thinly roasty, on the edge of burned, with a lean mouthfeel. Nearly salvaged by pleasantly delicate fruit notes – pear perhaps.
desc_4: Starbucks bashers looking for validation, I suppose. Something went wrong here between the coffee and the roast.
text: The aroma is flat and thin. In the cup sweetly but thinly roasty, on the edge of burned, with a lean mouthfeel. Nearly salvaged by pleasantly delicate fruit notes – pear perhaps.

desc_1: When hot, a robust, full-bodied dark roast with a pleasantly rough character: chocolate and wine tones in the aroma, in the cup a hint of fruity ferment and musty earth. As the coffee cools, however, the musty earth tones turn bitter and weigh oppressively on the cup.
desc_4: Those who go for the worm in the mescal.
text: When hot, a robust, full-bodied dark roast with a pleasantly rough character: chocolate and wine tones in the aroma, in the cup a hint of fruity ferment and musty earth. As the coffee cools, however, the musty earth tones turn bitter and weigh oppressively on the cup.

desc_1: Roasty, sweet and balanced in the aroma, with shimmers of pineapple. In the cup a light-bodied buoyancy and a continuing tickle of pineapple lifts the dominating sharp, edge-of-burned roastiness. Mildly astringent in the finish.
desc_4: Those who have a passion for mildly burned, slightly fruity dark roasts.
text: Roasty, sweet and balanced in the aroma, with shimmers of pineapple. In the cup a light-bodied buoyancy and a continuing tickle of pineapple lifts the dominating sharp, edge-of-burned roastiness. Mildly astringent in the finish.

desc_1: Sweetly roasty in the aroma, thin-bodied and sharply roasty in the cup. Almost disembodied floral top notes float above a bittersweet, prune-toned chocolate.
desc_4: Those who like a little Harrar with their dark roast.
text: Sweetly roasty in the aroma, thin-bodied and sharply roasty in the cup. Almost disembodied floral top notes float above a bittersweet, prune-toned chocolate.

desc_1: The aroma doesn’t provoke much anticipation: roasty, edge of burned, midtoned, without range or nuance. Softens and complicates in the cup, displaying a pleasantly wine-toned balance of sweet acidity and a discreetly bittersweet roastiness. Simplifies again in the rather sharp finish.
desc_4: This sturdy, tough dark roast should stand up well to whitener and sweetener.
text: The aroma doesn’t provoke much anticipation: roasty, edge of burned, midtoned, without range or nuance. Softens and complicates in the cup, displaying a pleasantly wine-toned balance of sweet acidity and a discreetly bittersweet roastiness. Simplifies again in the rather sharp finish.

desc_1: Impressive aroma: balanced, sweetly acidy yet gently roasty, with suggestions of chocolate and low-toned fruit – papaya or apricot. In the cup neither roasty nor acidy, however; simply bitter. Softens toward the finish but never completely recovers its opening balance and complexity.
desc_4: Milk or whitener softens the cup, releasing the fruit and chocolate notes from the rather stifling bitterness.
text: Impressive aroma: balanced, sweetly acidy yet gently roasty, with suggestions of chocolate and low-toned fruit – papaya or apricot. In the cup neither roasty nor acidy, however; simply bitter. Softens toward the finish but never completely recovers its opening balance and complexity.

desc_1: Cleanly smoky and rather richly roasty, complicated by shimmers of sweetly tart, high-toned fruit – pineapple perhaps.
desc_4: Dark roast lovers who prefer some smoke in their cup.
text: Cleanly smoky and rather richly roasty, complicated by shimmers of sweetly tart, high-toned fruit – pineapple perhaps.

desc_1: Massively roasty in the aroma: sweetly pungent with a sort of lush bar-b-qued apricot-toned fruit. Less impressive in the cup, where the main impression is simply the roast, heavy and burned but not rubbery. Given the weighty intensity of the roast sensation, surprisingly sweet and rich in the finish, with only a slight astringency.
desc_4: Dark-roast drinkers who like their cup big, blunt, and richly burned.
text: Massively roasty in the aroma: sweetly pungent with a sort of lush bar-b-qued apricot-toned fruit. Less impressive in the cup, where the main impression is simply the roast, heavy and burned but not rubbery. Given the weighty intensity of the roast sensation, surprisingly sweet and rich in the finish, with only a slight astringency.

desc_1: Straightforward, simple but satisfying dark-roast: cleanly roasty, pleasantly smoky but without burned or excessive bitterness. In cup and finish the roastiness takes on a toasty, campfire chocolate character.
desc_4: A classic old-fashioned Seattle-style dark roast, simple and robust.
text: Straightforward, simple but satisfying dark-roast: cleanly roasty, pleasantly smoky but without burned or excessive bitterness. In cup and finish the roastiness takes on a toasty, campfire chocolate character.

desc_1: A gently roasty, light-bodied blend: sweet, balanced, with fresh leather, grapefruit and sweet herb notes, lemon thyme perhaps. Slightly astringent in the finish.
desc_4: Those who like their dark roasts delicate and aromatic.
text: A gently roasty, light-bodied blend: sweet, balanced, with fresh leather, grapefruit and sweet herb notes, lemon thyme perhaps. Slightly astringent in the finish.

desc_1: In the aroma roasty, sweet, slightly burned, complicated by a prune-toned fruit just on the dry side of chocolate. In the cup the chocolate inclination of the fruit clearly declares itself, particularly as the coffee cools. The roasty tones turn a bit astringent in the finish.
desc_4: Those who enjoy raisins in their bittersweet chocolate.
text: In the aroma roasty, sweet, slightly burned, complicated by a prune-toned fruit just on the dry side of chocolate. In the cup the chocolate inclination of the fruit clearly declares itself, particularly as the coffee cools. The roasty tones turn a bit astringent in the finish.

desc_1: Sweetly balanced and gently roasty. Little distinguishable nuance, though the cup is pleasantly alive with an almost subliminal range of fruity sensation. Slight astringency in the finish.
desc_4: Those who wear comfortable clothes.
text: Sweetly balanced and gently roasty. Little distinguishable nuance, though the cup is pleasantly alive with an almost subliminal range of fruity sensation. Slight astringency in the finish.

desc_1: A heartily roasty, herb-toned, bittersweet chocolate dominates both aroma and cup, though turning a bit flat and burned in the finish. Overall narrow in range but pleasingly intense. Maintains character as it cools.
desc_4: Those who enjoy strong, simple gestures.
text: A heartily roasty, herb-toned, bittersweet chocolate dominates both aroma and cup, though turning a bit flat and burned in the finish. Overall narrow in range but pleasingly intense. Maintains character as it cools.

desc_1: Quietly complex aroma: sweet, discreetly roasty, with suggestions of leather, chocolate, apricot, perhaps pear. In the cup gentle, low-key, richly fruity with a lush apricot that flirts with chocolate.
desc_4: Those who take pleasure in the way a tactful dark roast turns a sweetly fruity coffee toward chocolate.
text: Quietly complex aroma: sweet, discreetly roasty, with suggestions of leather, chocolate, apricot, perhaps pear. In the cup gentle, low-key, richly fruity with a lush apricot that flirts with chocolate.

desc_1: In the aroma explosively sweet and exquisitely balanced, with chocolate and a gently gingery spice. In the cup complex and wide in range: roasty, pungent, with a tickle of lemony sweet acidity and a hint of musty earth. An underlying astringent heaviness weighs slightly on the finish.
desc_4: The hints of Ethiopia and Sumatra in this blend should please lovers of the exotic cup.
text: In the aroma explosively sweet and exquisitely balanced, with chocolate and a gently gingery spice. In the cup complex and wide in range: roasty, pungent, with a tickle of lemony sweet acidity and a hint of musty earth. An underlying astringent heaviness weighs slightly on the finish.

desc_1: Seductive aroma: sweet Meyer lemon, roasty chocolate, balanced and elegant. The lyric lemon and chocolate notes survive a sharp roastiness in the cup, but finally lose their way in the rather astringent finish.
desc_4: Those who enjoy a balanced, bittersweet dark roast, particularly those who enjoy it with milk or whitener.
text: Seductive aroma: sweet Meyer lemon, roasty chocolate, balanced and elegant. The lyric lemon and chocolate notes survive a sharp roastiness in the cup, but finally lose their way in the rather astringent finish.

desc_1: Finely balanced cup: delicately roasty, very sweet, with a shimmer of dry acidity. Under the impact of the roast the crisp aromatics lean toward leather and an herb-toned chocolate.
desc_4: This wonderfully sweet coffee with a gentle backbone of roastiness and acidity should make a fine multiple morning cup.
text: Finely balanced cup: delicately roasty, very sweet, with a shimmer of dry acidity. Under the impact of the roast the crisp aromatics lean toward leather and an herb-toned chocolate.

desc_1: Sweet and richly low-toned in the aroma, with shimmers of flowers, grapefruit and perhaps apples. In the cup the fruit turns opulently bittersweet under the impact of the roast: walnuts, dried apricots, bittersweet chocolate.
desc_4: Those who prefer Florence to Rome.
text: Sweet and richly low-toned in the aroma, with shimmers of flowers, grapefruit and perhaps apples. In the cup the fruit turns opulently bittersweet under the impact of the roast: walnuts, dried apricots, bittersweet chocolate.

desc_1: A delicate cup with impressive complexity: Lemon, smoky spice and milk chocolate notes carry with subtle variation from aroma through finish. In the cup, shows a fine balance of sweet acidity and a subtle roastiness, the roast making itself felt mainly in the smoky spice. The five cups I sampled displayed some unevenness; otherwise I would rate this silky, aromatic blend even higher.
desc_4: Starbucks scoffers.
text: A delicate cup with impressive complexity: Lemon, smoky spice and milk chocolate notes carry with subtle variation from aroma through finish. In the cup, shows a fine balance of sweet acidity and a subtle roastiness, the roast making itself felt mainly in the smoky spice. The five cups I sampled displayed some unevenness; otherwise I would rate this silky, aromatic blend even higher.

desc_1: Richly melodic coffee in which wine and apple notes carry from aroma through cup to finish. A tactful dark roast preserves a shimmer of acidity in the cup while contributing a slight herbal twist to the dominating apple-cider-like notes.
desc_4: Those interested in learning how a coffee with great character can preserve that character when dark-roasted with care.
text: Richly melodic coffee in which wine and apple notes carry from aroma through cup to finish. A tactful dark roast preserves a shimmer of acidity in the cup while contributing a slight herbal twist to the dominating apple-cider-like notes.

desc_1: Odd profile: simple, monotoned and woody in aroma, with some hints of cocoa and orange. In the cup very flat and herby, dominated by a bitter nut sensation. The finish is both monumentally bitter and extremely astringent.
desc_4: Masochists?
text: Odd profile: simple, monotoned and woody in aroma, with some hints of cocoa and orange. In the cup very flat and herby, dominated by a bitter nut sensation. The finish is both monumentally bitter and extremely astringent.

desc_1: Shallow and thin throughout. Sweet, caramelly, high-toned, but without nuance or dimension in either aroma or cup. Thin, astringent finish.
desc_4: This poor coffee has been reduced to a sort of Kenya Kool-Aid.
text: Shallow and thin throughout. Sweet, caramelly, high-toned, but without nuance or dimension in either aroma or cup. Thin, astringent finish.

desc_1: Caramelly and burned in the aroma; in the cup mildly roasty, crisp and bittersweet with a tickle of acidity. The bitterness intensifies as the cup cools, exaggerating the flat, astringent finish.
desc_4: Fast drinkers.
text: Caramelly and burned in the aroma; in the cup mildly roasty, crisp and bittersweet with a tickle of acidity. The bitterness intensifies as the cup cools, exaggerating the flat, astringent finish.

desc_1: The aroma is full and smokily roasty though monotoned. In the cup thinnish, smoky and simple, with rather unpleasant tobacco notes, the stale ashtray sort rather than the rich pipe tobacco kind.
desc_4: Possibly those who enjoy the exaggerated smoky sensation of bottled bar-b-que sauces.
text: The aroma is full and smokily roasty though monotoned. In the cup thinnish, smoky and simple, with rather unpleasant tobacco notes, the stale ashtray sort rather than the rich pipe tobacco kind.

desc_1: The aroma is woody with faint lemon and chocolate suggestions. The body is substantial, the cup round in mouthfeel with a low-toned acidity complicated by a vague dry fruit, more like prune pits than prunes. Further flattens and turns astringent as the cup cools.
desc_4: Fast drinkers.
text: The aroma is woody with faint lemon and chocolate suggestions. The body is substantial, the cup round in mouthfeel with a low-toned acidity complicated by a vague dry fruit, more like prune pits than prunes. Further flattens and turns astringent as the cup cools.

desc_1: The aroma is shallow and cloyingly sweet, though complicated by pleasant Meyer lemon notes. The lemon notes carry into the otherwise undistinguished cup, which is thinly acidy and simple.
desc_4: Those who enjoy sweet-toned, lemony beverages.
text: The aroma is shallow and cloyingly sweet, though complicated by pleasant Meyer lemon notes. The lemon notes carry into the otherwise undistinguished cup, which is thinly acidy and simple.

desc_1: The aroma is full and round with pleasant if rather shallow lemon and floral notes. In the cup a woody bitterness obliterates the floral notes and turns the lemon tones pithy and hard. The finish is both bitter and astringent.
desc_4: Those who slow down on freeways to gawk at accidents. For an aficionado there is a macabre fascination in tasting a coffee that comes across as a parody of itself.
text: The aroma is full and round with pleasant if rather shallow lemon and floral notes. In the cup a woody bitterness obliterates the floral notes and turns the lemon tones pithy and hard. The finish is both bitter and astringent.

desc_1: The aroma is delicate to a fault, more neutral than balanced. The mouthfeel is lean and the flavor watery, with a faintly sweet, delicately acidy character complicated by attractive grapefruit notes.
desc_4: Perhaps tea-drinkers, who may appreciate its extremely light body and delicate presence.
text: The aroma is delicate to a fault, more neutral than balanced. The mouthfeel is lean and the flavor watery, with a faintly sweet, delicately acidy character complicated by attractive grapefruit notes.

desc_1: Virtually no aroma. The cup is potatoey and flat on first impression, but with patient drinking a quietly satisfying profile emerges, with a balance of bitter, sweet, and acidy tones complicated by a low-key fruit that sneaks up on milk chocolate.
desc_4: First-time lovers who avoid excitement.
text: Virtually no aroma. The cup is potatoey and flat on first impression, but with patient drinking a quietly satisfying profile emerges, with a balance of bitter, sweet, and acidy tones complicated by a low-key fruit that sneaks up on milk chocolate.

origin: Tarrazu growing region, central Costa Rica
desc_1: Rich, bracingly bittersweet aroma – caramel, a tickle of chocolate, pure classic coffee fruit notes – but in the cup disappointingly lean and shallow in dimension, particularly as the cup cools. Recovers slightly in the thin but cleanly sweet finish.
desc_4: Those who find the overture more exciting than the dance.
text: Rich, bracingly bittersweet aroma – caramel, a tickle of chocolate, pure classic coffee fruit notes – but in the cup disappointingly lean and shallow in dimension, particularly as the cup cools. Recovers slightly in the thin but cleanly sweet finish.

desc_1: A coffee seen from the far end of the taste telescope, intriguing but shrunk and diminished. The aroma is lushly sweet with a hint of grapefruit. The cup is sweet as well, but complicated only by an agreeable but simple acidity. Once past the aroma little nuance of any kind. Slightly astringent in the finish.
desc_4: Brian Eno fans.
text: A coffee seen from the far end of the taste telescope, intriguing but shrunk and diminished. The aroma is lushly sweet with a hint of grapefruit. The cup is sweet as well, but complicated only by an agreeable but simple acidity. Once past the aroma little nuance of any kind. Slightly astringent in the finish.

desc_1: Round and full in aroma, with caramel midtones and tartly sweet topnotes: passion fruit and pink grapefruit. The impressive aromatics are overwhelmed in the cup by a rather bitter acidity, though the passion fruit notes emerge again in the finish.
desc_4: Those who find themselves vacillating between the voluptuous and the challenging.
text: Round and full in aroma, with caramel midtones and tartly sweet topnotes: passion fruit and pink grapefruit. The impressive aromatics are overwhelmed in the cup by a rather bitter acidity, though the passion fruit notes emerge again in the finish.

desc_1: Smoky, leathery and sweet in the aroma, with a hint of low-toned fruit. Softens and relaxes in the cup, with the smoky fruit sweetening toward chocolate. Lean in mouthfeel but rich in impression.
desc_4: Caffeine-avoiding lovers of the gently smoky style of darker-roast cup.
text: Smoky, leathery and sweet in the aroma, with a hint of low-toned fruit. Softens and relaxes in the cup, with the smoky fruit sweetening toward chocolate. Lean in mouthfeel but rich in impression.

desc_1: The aroma is round and intense but limited in nuance. The cup adds a complicating hint of chocolate-toned fruit to a similarly limited but balanced and deeply resonant profile.
desc_4: Lovers of comfortable chairs and easy conversation.
text: The aroma is round and intense but limited in nuance. The cup adds a complicating hint of chocolate-toned fruit to a similarly limited but balanced and deeply resonant profile.

desc_1: Balanced, low-toned aroma with a tickle of fruit and chocolate. Maintains its character in the cup: low-toned, understated, balanced, complicated by a faintly chocolate-inclining prune and apricot.
desc_4: Low-toned folks who enjoy a little apricot-chocolate adventure.
text: Balanced, low-toned aroma with a tickle of fruit and chocolate. Maintains its character in the cup: low-toned, understated, balanced, complicated by a faintly chocolate-inclining prune and apricot.

desc_1: Sweet, low-key, expansive aroma. In the cup rich and cleanly roasty, with an agreeable bittersweet balance complicated by fresh leather, chocolate and a shimmer of sweet grapefruit. The grapefruit persists in the rich but astringent finish.
desc_4: Those who enjoy complex, bittersweet dark roasts without burned tones.
text: Sweet, low-key, expansive aroma. In the cup rich and cleanly roasty, with an agreeable bittersweet balance complicated by fresh leather, chocolate and a shimmer of sweet grapefruit. The grapefruit persists in the rich but astringent finish.

desc_1: The authoritative aroma is dominated by low-toned fruit: apricot or papaya. In the cup the fruit brightens, lifts and intensifies, suggesting a tartly sweet temperate fruit like green apples. Light-to-medium-bodied but roundly smooth in mouthfeel; sweetly acidy.
desc_4: A classic American breakfast cup in a single-serve format.
text: The authoritative aroma is dominated by low-toned fruit: apricot or papaya. In the cup the fruit brightens, lifts and intensifies, suggesting a tartly sweet temperate fruit like green apples. Light-to-medium-bodied but roundly smooth in mouthfeel; sweetly acidy.

desc_1: Thin but intense aroma, with distinct papaya-toned fruit. Medium-bodied but lively in the cup, where the high-toned fruit, still reminiscent of papaya, takes on a delicate chocolate richness. Sweet, balanced acidity.
desc_4: Its clean fruit and delicately tart sweetness makes this an ideal coffee for those traditional coffee drinkers who take their cup without sugar or whitener.
text: Thin but intense aroma, with distinct papaya-toned fruit. Medium-bodied but lively in the cup, where the high-toned fruit, still reminiscent of papaya, takes on a delicate chocolate richness. Sweet, balanced acidity.

desc_1: The aroma is subdued and gently roasty. Clear, dry, deep-toned chocolate-fruit notes carry from aroma through cup to a slightly bitter but rich finish.
desc_4: Substantial body and a hint of dark-roast bite give the chocolate and fruit a pleasant after dinner authority.
text: The aroma is subdued and gently roasty. Clear, dry, deep-toned chocolate-fruit notes carry from aroma through cup to a slightly bitter but rich finish.

desc_1: The sweet musty tones that run from aroma into cup read as distinctly nut-like — walnuts perhaps — with an edge of low-toned fruit: pumpkin and papaya. All of that detail fades in the finish, which is long, lush, and sweetly clean.
desc_4: Lovers of regional tradition: This is a blend that refers honorably and explicitly to southern Louisiana coffee tradition.
text: The sweet musty tones that run from aroma into cup read as distinctly nut-like — walnuts perhaps — with an edge of low-toned fruit: pumpkin and papaya. All of that detail fades in the finish, which is long, lush, and sweetly clean.

desc_1: A big-bodied, massively roasty coffee. Intense musty tones read as rosemary, cardamom perhaps, with a shimmer of chocolate. The intense, monumental character fades a bit as the cup cools.
desc_4: Lovers of those dark-roasted coffees that impose their authority on almost any quantity of milk.
text: A big-bodied, massively roasty coffee. Intense musty tones read as rosemary, cardamom perhaps, with a shimmer of chocolate. The intense, monumental character fades a bit as the cup cools.

desc_1: Crisp, wine- and cherry-toned fruit dominate in both aroma and cup. A delicate mustiness reads as leather and sweet pipe tobacco. The rather heavy finish lightens and sweetens as the cup cools.
desc_4: Lovers of traditional Sumatras, who should enjoy this elegant variant on the apples and leather theme.
text: Crisp, wine- and cherry-toned fruit dominate in both aroma and cup. A delicate mustiness reads as leather and sweet pipe tobacco. The rather heavy finish lightens and sweetens as the cup cools.

desc_1: Low-key, pungent aroma laced with cocoa and caramel. Sweet in the cup with enveloping bottom notes of overripe fruit and sweet humus. Surprising floral notes in the finish.
desc_4: Those who want to bring the garden into breakfast.
text: Low-key, pungent aroma laced with cocoa and caramel. Sweet in the cup with enveloping bottom notes of overripe fruit and sweet humus. Surprising floral notes in the finish.

desc_1: Cinnamon, pumpkin, chocolate smeared on leather in the aroma. In the cup overripe, lush, half-rotting fruit and carnal melon tones eventually suggest chocolate, which sweetens and rounds in the long, surprisingly clean finish.
desc_4: Lovers of peaty single-malt scotches, cheeses that have ripened a little too long, the more extreme of blue cheeses.
text: Cinnamon, pumpkin, chocolate smeared on leather in the aroma. In the cup overripe, lush, half-rotting fruit and carnal melon tones eventually suggest chocolate, which sweetens and rounds in the long, surprisingly clean finish.

desc_1: The aroma is subdued but complex with leather, chocolate and apricot. In the cup a fine balance of bitter bite and seductive sweetness, complicated by an apricot-almond-toned fruit and a crisp bittersweet chocolate. Medium-bodied, gently rich.
desc_4: This bittersweet blend provides comfort without sentimentality.
text: The aroma is subdued but complex with leather, chocolate and apricot. In the cup a fine balance of bitter bite and seductive sweetness, complicated by an apricot-almond-toned fruit and a crisp bittersweet chocolate. Medium-bodied, gently rich.

desc_1: A sweet, lyric coffee with remarkable complexity, starting with the aroma — distinct leather notes, winy fruit, milk chocolate — to the cup, where the wine tones deepen and take on an almost smoky edge. Clean, sweet, grape-like finish.
desc_4: Lovers of subtly adventurous beverages.
text: A sweet, lyric coffee with remarkable complexity, starting with the aroma — distinct leather notes, winy fruit, milk chocolate — to the cup, where the wine tones deepen and take on an almost smoky edge. Clean, sweet, grape-like finish.

desc_1: The aroma is high-toned but pungent, laced with caramel, cantaloupe and leather. In the cup a sweet, wine-toned fruit leads, with richly malty, bracingly bitter tones opening up behind. The bitterness dissolves in the long, clean, chocolate-toned finish.
desc_4: Those who enjoy paradox, in this case, austere seduction.
text: The aroma is high-toned but pungent, laced with caramel, cantaloupe and leather. In the cup a sweet, wine-toned fruit leads, with richly malty, bracingly bitter tones opening up behind. The bitterness dissolves in the long, clean, chocolate-toned finish.

desc_1: Opens with a very sweet, very intense but balanced aroma complicated by apples and flowers. In the cup the gentle acidity subordinates itself to a melodic sweetness and a rich, deeply dimensioned chocolate- and apple-toned fruit. Lyric and seductive.
desc_4: Lovers of Mozart and the Beach Boys.
text: Opens with a very sweet, very intense but balanced aroma complicated by apples and flowers. In the cup the gentle acidity subordinates itself to a melodic sweetness and a rich, deeply dimensioned chocolate- and apple-toned fruit. Lyric and seductive.

desc_1: Delicate apple, leather, and milk chocolate notes in the sweet, mid-toned aroma. The cup is explicit in its clear chocolate notes, complicated by dry fruit tones that suggest raisins or dates. Substantial body and a sweet, clean finish.
desc_4: Subtle chocolate lovers.
text: Delicate apple, leather, and milk chocolate notes in the sweet, mid-toned aroma. The cup is explicit in its clear chocolate notes, complicated by dry fruit tones that suggest raisins or dates. Substantial body and a sweet, clean finish.

desc_1: The pungently sweet roast dominates, but with a light touch. Shimmers of apple and pear glint in the aroma, flowers and dark chocolate in the cup. The finish is cleanly bittersweet but mildly astringent.
desc_4: Light-hearted dark-roast lovers.
text: The pungently sweet roast dominates, but with a light touch. Shimmers of apple and pear glint in the aroma, flowers and dark chocolate in the cup. The finish is cleanly bittersweet but mildly astringent.

desc_1: Roasty and sweet in the nose, with excellent balance and dimension. In the cup soft, gently roasty, and cocoa-toned. Long, unobtrusively rich finish.
desc_4: Those who enjoy company but do not need attention.
text: Roasty and sweet in the nose, with excellent balance and dimension. In the cup soft, gently roasty, and cocoa-toned. Long, unobtrusively rich finish.

desc_1: Pungently roasty with cantaloupe notes in the aroma. In the cup softens nicely, allowing some sweet lemon and grapefruit notes to glisten in the smooth, rather delicate roastiness. Sweet but gently astringent finish.
desc_4: Plenty good enough for emergencies.
text: Pungently roasty with cantaloupe notes in the aroma. In the cup softens nicely, allowing some sweet lemon and grapefruit notes to glisten in the smooth, rather delicate roastiness. Sweet but gently astringent finish.

desc_1: The roast dominates this delicate coffee, but pleasantly so, turning the aroma caramelly with low-toned raisin and delicate vanilla notes. In the cup a finely balanced synthesis of acidity and roast taste, sharp but sweet, with the caramel and vanilla tones persisting through the long finish.
desc_4: Those who enjoy a prestigious name in a darker-roast style.
text: The roast dominates this delicate coffee, but pleasantly so, turning the aroma caramelly with low-toned raisin and delicate vanilla notes. In the cup a finely balanced synthesis of acidity and roast taste, sharp but sweet, with the caramel and vanilla tones persisting through the long finish.

desc_1: Variants on citrus shimmer through this buoyant, sweetly acidy cup: lemon and cocoa in the aroma, lemon and pink grapefruit in the cup. The finish is sweetly tart.
desc_4: Lovers of lightly sweet white wines.
text: Variants on citrus shimmer through this buoyant, sweetly acidy cup: lemon and cocoa in the aroma, lemon and pink grapefruit in the cup. The finish is sweetly tart.

desc_1: The aroma is high-toned and softly intense, with peach and cantaloupe notes that carry gracefully into the cup. A gentle acidity and a glint of citrus give the soft fruit authority.
desc_4: Those who persist in wearing aloha shirts in September.
text: The aroma is high-toned and softly intense, with peach and cantaloupe notes that carry gracefully into the cup. A gentle acidity and a glint of citrus give the soft fruit authority.

desc_1: Mid-toned and complex in the nose with fresh apricot and sweet cocoa. Simplifies slightly in the cup, turning roundly tart in a rich Meyer lemon direction. The immediate finish is slightly sharp, but the long finish smoothes out in a silky lemony, chocolaty trajectory.
desc_4: Name droppers with good taste.
text: Mid-toned and complex in the nose with fresh apricot and sweet cocoa. Simplifies slightly in the cup, turning roundly tart in a rich Meyer lemon direction. The immediate finish is slightly sharp, but the long finish smoothes out in a silky lemony, chocolaty trajectory.

desc_1: The aroma is sweet, gently pungent, rich with low-toned, spicy fruit notes. The cup is medium-bodied, round, very sweet, with just enough acidity for authority. The low-toned fruit leans elegantly toward chocolate.
desc_4: Socially responsible coffee drinkers who enjoy a resonant, gently roasty cup.
text: The aroma is sweet, gently pungent, rich with low-toned, spicy fruit notes. The cup is medium-bodied, round, very sweet, with just enough acidity for authority. The low-toned fruit leans elegantly toward chocolate.

desc_1: A challengingly acidy coffee, by sweetly so. A sensitive roast rounds the acidity and deepens the fruit, turning it toward sweet cocoa and ripe cherry. Glints of jasmine. The cocoa-toned fruit persists agreeably through the finish.
desc_4: Lovers of big, acidy coffees with just a hint of roastiness.
text: A challengingly acidy coffee, by sweetly so. A sensitive roast rounds the acidity and deepens the fruit, turning it toward sweet cocoa and ripe cherry. Glints of jasmine. The cocoa-toned fruit persists agreeably through the finish.

origin: Tarrazu growing region, central Costa Rica
desc_1: A tribute to classic balance: pure but substantial, quietly intense without extremes. Gently acidy, deeply rich, discreetly complicated by tightly laced notes of leather, chocolate and fruit.
desc_4: Those who are equally impressed by name and substance.
text: A tribute to classic balance: pure but substantial, quietly intense without extremes. Gently acidy, deeply rich, discreetly complicated by tightly laced notes of leather, chocolate and fruit.

desc_1: High-toned, complex aroma: sweet citrus, cherry, apple. In the cup gently acidy, while the fruit maintains its complex, elegant trajectory: Meyer lemon, grapefruit, tart berry. The initial, almost shocking rush of sweetness is balanced by a crisply bitter finish.
desc_4: Lovers of discreet drama.
text: High-toned, complex aroma: sweet citrus, cherry, apple. In the cup gently acidy, while the fruit maintains its complex, elegant trajectory: Meyer lemon, grapefruit, tart berry. The initial, almost shocking rush of sweetness is balanced by a crisply bitter finish.

desc_1: Light-bodied, just on the pleasingly delicate side of thin, with oddly contradictory nuance: a roasty, prune-toned chocolate and high-toned shimmers of sweet vanilla.
desc_4: The light body argues for breakfast, the subtle but persistent roasty chocolate and sweet vanilla make a case for afternoon comfort cup.
text: Light-bodied, just on the pleasingly delicate side of thin, with oddly contradictory nuance: a roasty, prune-toned chocolate and high-toned shimmers of sweet vanilla.

desc_1: Magnificent cup when hot: powerfully but sweetly acidy, resonating with complex chocolate nuance from aroma through finish. The acidity turns rather bitter and the profile simplifies as the cup cools.
desc_4: Fast coffee drinkers. When hot, a splendid breakfast cup, simultaneously bracing and seductive.
text: Magnificent cup when hot: powerfully but sweetly acidy, resonating with complex chocolate nuance from aroma through finish. The acidity turns rather bitter and the profile simplifies as the cup cools.

desc_1: A delicate acidity is gently rounded though not obscured by a marvelously tactful dark roast, which also turns the fruit richly chocolate-toned. The chocolate nuance weaves through the profile consistently from aroma through finish.
desc_4: The suave tickle of roast-toned chocolate is subtly reminiscent of the Boy Scout summer treat of "S'More's" - milk chocolate and marshmallow sandwiched between graham crackers roasted in an open fire on the end of a stick. A s'more for sophisticates.
text: A delicate acidity is gently rounded though not obscured by a marvelously tactful dark roast, which also turns the fruit richly chocolate-toned. The chocolate nuance weaves through the profile consistently from aroma through finish.

desc_1: The roast dominates this rather delicate coffee, though cleanly and without introducing burned or bitter notes. Roasty, mildly rich, subdued, slightly astringent in the finish.
desc_4: Those who prefer smooth, understated dark roasts.
text: The roast dominates this rather delicate coffee, though cleanly and without introducing burned or bitter notes. Roasty, mildly rich, subdued, slightly astringent in the finish.

desc_1: The good news is this moderately dark roast displays a rich depth of sensation and spicy, smoky notes in the nose. The bad news: The roast also imposes a rather gritty, astringent finish.
desc_4: The full body and deep dimension makes this coffee a good choice for those French-pressers who enjoy a heavily textured cup. Should persevere nicely through milk and sweetener.
text: The good news is this moderately dark roast displays a rich depth of sensation and spicy, smoky notes in the nose. The bad news: The roast also imposes a rather gritty, astringent finish.

desc_1: The cup is dominated by a simple, rich acidity. The acidy sensation is rather sharp and overbearing when the cup is hot, though it rounds and sweetens as the cup cools, revealing wine-toned fruit and a resonance that could only be guessed at when the cup was hot.
desc_4: Slow drinkers. This dry, powerfully acidy coffee is a purist's cup, challenging and bracing.
text: The cup is dominated by a simple, rich acidity. The acidy sensation is rather sharp and overbearing when the cup is hot, though it rounds and sweetens as the cup cools, revealing wine-toned fruit and a resonance that could only be guessed at when the cup was hot.

desc_1: A powerfully acidy coffee, sharply rich and winy. Beneath the acidy assertion patient drinking reveals subdued but seductive floral undertones. The aromatics are splendid but the mouthfeel is a bit too astringent for my taste.
desc_4: Lovers of the big, blazingly acidy old-fashioned American cup.
text: A powerfully acidy coffee, sharply rich and winy. Beneath the acidy assertion patient drinking reveals subdued but seductive floral undertones. The aromatics are splendid but the mouthfeel is a bit too astringent for my taste.

desc_1: Splendid aroma: sweet, smoky/spicy, cantaloupe notes. In the cup brightly acidy, the cantaloupe notes turning tart and tamarind-toned.
desc_4: A straightforward, relatively light-roasted breakfast cup in the traditional American style with a teasing hint of deep-toned, carnal fruit.
text: Splendid aroma: sweet, smoky/spicy, cantaloupe notes. In the cup brightly acidy, the cantaloupe notes turning tart and tamarind-toned.

desc_1: High-toned, rather delicate, with a crisply dry but sweet acidity. Raisins and vanilla, in the aroma, tart tropical fruit tones – tamarind or passion fruit – in the cup.
desc_4: Those looking to fall in love with a dry but delicately fruity breakfast cup.
text: High-toned, rather delicate, with a crisply dry but sweet acidity. Raisins and vanilla, in the aroma, tart tropical fruit tones – tamarind or passion fruit – in the cup.

desc_1: Delicate, gently and elegantly acidy, complicated by a discreetly rich cherry fruit leaning toward chocolate. The acidity is sweet and exquisitely balanced, though slightly astringent in the finish.
desc_4: A classically delicate Guatemala breakfast cup with a dash of mild astringency that will strike some as sharp and others as bracing.
text: Delicate, gently and elegantly acidy, complicated by a discreetly rich cherry fruit leaning toward chocolate. The acidity is sweet and exquisitely balanced, though slightly astringent in the finish.

desc_1: When hot, complexly and giddily floral and fruity – caramel in the aroma, suggestions of lilac and violet, papaya and cantaloupe in the cup. The extravagantly fruity character of the cup hints at sweet ferment, which in fact emerges as the cup cools, hardening the profile a bit and turning it slightly salty. But try it; no one drinks coffee cold anyhow except coffee reviewers.
desc_4: Fast coffee drinkers and lovers of extravagance and complexity.
text: When hot, complexly and giddily floral and fruity – caramel in the aroma, suggestions of lilac and violet, papaya and cantaloupe in the cup. The extravagantly fruity character of the cup hints at sweet ferment, which in fact emerges as the cup cools, hardening the profile a bit and turning it slightly salty. But try it; no one drinks coffee cold anyhow except coffee reviewers.

desc_1: A balanced, smoothly full-bodied cup with a sweet acidity and a subdued roastiness that turns the fruit toward cantaloupe and black cherry.
desc_4: A satisfying, versatile cup with enough roastiness for those who crave it and sufficient acidy brightness to please black coffee drinkers of the traditional school.
text: A balanced, smoothly full-bodied cup with a sweet acidity and a subdued roastiness that turns the fruit toward cantaloupe and black cherry.

desc_1: This voluptuously round dark roast is a tribute to the roastmaster’s art. Opulently and robustly roasty, sweet, and utterly without burned bitterness. Not much nuance, but plenty of sweet, resonant depth and smoky-spicy tones.
desc_4: Those who love dark roasts but don't care for bitterness. This naturally sweet, full-bodied dark roast should be able to handle large quantities of milk, simultaneously making it both an excellent with-milk breakfast cup and a satisfying black after-dinner demitasse.
text: This voluptuously round dark roast is a tribute to the roastmaster’s art. Opulently and robustly roasty, sweet, and utterly without burned bitterness. Not much nuance, but plenty of sweet, resonant depth and smoky-spicy tones.

desc_1: The most impressive aspect of this sweet, balanced, gently acidy cup is a tactful roast that turns the fruit richly chocolate. The chocolate tones carry elegantly from aroma through a quietly opulent finish.
desc_4: Subtly pervasive chocolate tones turn this pleasing coffee into a sort of stand-alone, caffeine-free dessert.
text: The most impressive aspect of this sweet, balanced, gently acidy cup is a tactful roast that turns the fruit richly chocolate. The chocolate tones carry elegantly from aroma through a quietly opulent finish.
